chapter.keywords: online king james holy bible, king james bible, bible todo list, words of Jesus, bible index, the authorised version, KJV, KJB, KJAV, AV

items.text: As snow in summer, and as rain in harvest, so honour is not seemly for a fool.
items.plainText: As snow in summer, and as rain in harvest, so honour is not seemly for a fool.

items.text: As the bird by wandering, as the swallow by flying, so the curse causeless shall not come.
items.plainText: As the bird by wandering, as the swallow by flying, so the curse causeless shall not come.

items.text: A whip for the horse, a bridle for the ass, and a rod for the fool's back.
items.plainText: A whip for the horse, a bridle for the ass, and a rod for the fool's back.

items.text: Answer not a fool according to his folly, lest thou also be like unto him.
items.plainText: Answer not a fool according to his folly, lest thou also be like unto him.

items.text: Answer a fool according to his folly, lest he be wise in his own conceit.
items.plainText: Answer a fool according to his folly, lest he be wise in his own conceit.

items.text: He that sendeth a message by the hand of a fool cutteth off the feet, and drinketh damage.
items.plainText: He that sendeth a message by the hand of a fool cutteth off the feet, and drinketh damage.

items.text: The legs of the lame are not equal: so is a parable in the mouth of fools.
items.plainText: The legs of the lame are not equal: so is a parable in the mouth of fools.

items.text: As he that bindeth a stone in a sling, so is he that giveth honour to a fool.
items.plainText: As he that bindeth a stone in a sling, so is he that giveth honour to a fool.

items.text: As a thorn goeth up into the hand of a drunkard, so is a parable in the mouth of fools.
items.plainText: As a thorn goeth up into the hand of a drunkard, so is a parable in the mouth of fools.

items.text: The great God that formed all things both rewardeth the fool, and rewardeth transgressors.
items.plainText: The great God that formed all things both rewardeth the fool, and rewardeth transgressors.

items.text: As a dog returneth to his vomit, so a fool returneth to his folly.
items.plainText: As a dog returneth to his vomit, so a fool returneth to his folly.

items.text: Seest thou a man wise in his own conceit? there is more hope of a fool than of him.
items.plainText: Seest thou a man wise in his own conceit? there is more hope of a fool than of him.

items.text: The slothful man saith, There is a lion in the way; a lion is in the streets.
items.plainText: The slothful man saith, There is a lion in the way; a lion is in the streets.

items.text: As the door turneth upon his hinges, so doth the slothful upon his bed.
items.plainText: As the door turneth upon his hinges, so doth the slothful upon his bed.

items.text: The slothful hideth his hand in his bosom; it grieveth him to bring it again to his mouth.
items.plainText: The slothful hideth his hand in his bosom; it grieveth him to bring it again to his mouth.

items.text: The sluggard is wiser in his own conceit than seven men that can render a reason.
items.plainText: The sluggard is wiser in his own conceit than seven men that can render a reason.

items.text: He that passeth by, and meddleth with strife belonging not to him, is like one that taketh a dog by the ears.
items.plainText: He that passeth by, and meddleth with strife belonging not to him, is like one that taketh a dog by the ears.

items.text: As a mad man who casteth firebrands, arrows, and death,
items.plainText: As a mad man who casteth firebrands, arrows, and death,

items.text: So is the man that deceiveth his neighbour, and saith, Am not I in sport?
items.plainText: So is the man that deceiveth his neighbour, and saith, Am not I in sport?

items.text: Where no wood is, there the fire goeth out: so where there is no talebearer, the strife ceaseth.
items.plainText: Where no wood is, there the fire goeth out: so where there is no talebearer, the strife ceaseth.

items.text: As coals are to burning coals, and wood to fire; so is a contentious man to kindle strife.
items.plainText: As coals are to burning coals, and wood to fire; so is a contentious man to kindle strife.

items.text: The words of a talebearer are as wounds, and they go down into the innermost parts of the belly.
items.plainText: The words of a talebearer are as wounds, and they go down into the innermost parts of the belly.

items.text: Burning lips and a wicked heart are like a potsherd covered with silver dross.
items.plainText: Burning lips and a wicked heart are like a potsherd covered with silver dross.

items.text: He that hateth dissembleth with his lips, and layeth up deceit within him;
items.plainText: He that hateth dissembleth with his lips, and layeth up deceit within him;

items.text: When he speaketh fair, believe him not: for there are seven abominations in his heart.
items.plainText: When he speaketh fair, believe him not: for there are seven abominations in his heart.

items.text: Whose hatred is covered by deceit, his wickedness shall be shewed before the whole congregation.
items.plainText: Whose hatred is covered by deceit, his wickedness shall be shewed before the whole congregation.

items.text: Whoso diggeth a pit shall fall therein: and he that rolleth a stone, it will return upon him.
items.plainText: Whoso diggeth a pit shall fall therein: and he that rolleth a stone, it will return upon him.

items.text: A lying tongue hateth those that are afflicted by it; and a flattering mouth worketh ruin.
items.plainText: A lying tongue hateth those that are afflicted by it; and a flattering mouth worketh ruin.
